content: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer. Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, and USB drives. Remove your laptop from its docking station, if applicable. Power on your computer and press F8 repeatedly when the Dell logo displays on-screen. This opens the Advanced Boot Options menu. If the Advanced Boot Options menu fails to open, restart your computer and try again. Select “Repair Your Computer” using the arrow keys, then press “Enter. ” This opens the System Recovery Options menu Select a keyboard layout and click “Next. ” Sign in as a local user or the administrator, then click “OK. ” Select either “Dell Factory Tools” or “Dell Factory Image Restore,” then click “Next. ” This opens the Confirm Data Deletion menu. Place a checkmark next to “Yes, reformat hard drive and restore system software to factory condition,” then click “Next. ” Windows 7 will begin restoring factory settings, which will take at least five minutes to complete. When finished, Windows will inform you the computer has been restored to a factory-new condition. Click on “Finish. ” Your computer will restart and the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen. Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer. Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives. Power on your computer and click on the “Start” menu. If Windows fails to boot up correctly and you cannot access the Start menu, press F11 repeatedly as your computer reboots to bring up the Recovery Manager window, then skip to step #7. Click on “All Programs,” then select “Recovery Manager. ” Click on “Recovery Manager” again, then type the administrator password. Select “Yes” when the User Account Control window asks if you want the program to make changes to your computer. The Recovery Manager window will display on-screen. Select “System Recovery” below the section entitled “I need help immediately. ” Select “Yes,” then click “Next” when asked if you want the computer restored to its original factory condition. Your computer will reboot, and display the Recovery Manager window once again. Select “System Recovery,” then select “Recover without backing up your files. ” Click on “OK” to confirm you want factory settings restored, then select “Finish. ” Your computer will restart and display the Windows 7 setup screen. [1] Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer. Restart your computer and press the left Alt + F10 keys when the Acer logo displays on-screen. This displays the Acer eRecovery Management application. Press “Enter” if the Microsoft Windows boot screen appears to advance to the eRecovery Management window. Select “Completely Restore System to Factory Defaults,” then click “Next. ” [2] Click “Next” again to confirm you want to restore the original factory settings. The restoration process will begin, which can take anywhere between 10 and 60 minutes. When factory restoration is complete, the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen. [3] Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer. Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives. Verify that your Toshiba computer is connected to a power source. This prevents the computer from powering down during the factory restore process. Restart your computer, then press and hold down the “0” key on the keyboard. This brings up the recovery warning screen. If the recovery warning screen fails to display, restart your computer and try again. Click on “Yes” to confirm that you want to proceed with system recovery. This opens the Toshiba Recovery Wizard. Select “Recovery of Factory Software,” the follow the on-screen instructions to restore your computer’s original factory settings. Your computer will reboot several times throughout the process, and display the Windows 7 welcome screen when complete. [4] Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer. Restart your Windows 7 computer, then watch your computer screen to find the appropriate bootup command. In most cases, bootup commands will display at either the top or bottom of your screen. Press the appropriate bootup command to access your computer’s recovery partition. Bootup commands will vary depending on your computer’s manufacturer: Asus: Press F9 Lenovo: Press F11 MSI: Press F3 Samsung: Press F4 Sony: Press F10 Select the option to restore your computer to factory settings. This option is labeled differently for each manufacturer, since each manufacturer uses different software for the built-in recovery partition. In most cases, this option will read as “Restore factory settings” or “Perform factory restore.” Follow the on-screen instructions to restore the original factory settings. Your computer may reboot several times throughout the process, which may take up to one hour to complete. When restoration is finished, the Windows setup wizard or welcome screen will display. [5]

<p>Restoring your Windows 7 computer to its original factory settings returns your system to a factory-fresh software state so you can resell your computer or experience a fresh start as a user. Instructions for restoring your computer’s factory settings will vary depending on its manufacturer.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Dell_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Dell">Dell</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.</b> Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals.</b> This includes printers, scanners, network cables, and USB drives.
<ul>
<li>Remove your laptop from its docking station, if applicable.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Power on your computer and press F8 repeatedly when the Dell logo displays on-screen.</b> This opens the Advanced Boot Options menu.
<ul>
<li>If the Advanced Boot Options menu fails to open, restart your computer and try again.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “Repair Your Computer” using the arrow keys, then press “Enter.</b><b>”</b> This opens the System Recovery Options menu</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select a keyboard layout and click “Next.</b><b>”</b>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Sign in as a local user or the administrator, then click “OK.</b><b>”</b>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select either “Dell Factory Tools” or “Dell Factory Image Restore,” then click “Next.</b><b>”</b> This opens the Confirm Data Deletion menu.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Place a checkmark next to “Yes, reformat hard drive and restore system software to factory condition,” then click “Next.</b><b>”</b> Windows 7 will begin restoring factory settings, which will take at least five minutes to complete. When finished, Windows will inform you the computer has been restored to a factory-new condition.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Click on “Finish.</b><b>”</b> Your computer will restart and the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Hewlett-Packard_.28HP.29_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Hewlett-Packard_.28HP.29">Hewlett-Packard (HP)</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.</b> Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals.</b> This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Power on your computer and click on the “Start” menu.</b>
<ul>
<li>If Windows fails to boot up correctly and you cannot access the Start menu, press F11 repeatedly as your computer reboots to bring up the Recovery Manager window, then skip to step #7.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Click on “All Programs,” then select “Recovery Manager.</b><b>”</b>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step"><b class="whb">Click on “Recovery Manager” again, then type the administrator password.</b></div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “Yes” when the User Account Control window asks if you want the program to make changes to your computer.</b> The Recovery Manager window will display on-screen.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “System Recovery” below the section entitled “I need help immediately.</b><b>”</b>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “Yes,” then click “Next” when asked if you want the computer restored to its original factory condition.</b> Your computer will reboot, and display the Recovery Manager window once again.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “System Recovery,” then select “Recover without backing up your files.</b><b>”</b>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 10" class="step_num">10</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_10"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Click on “OK” to confirm you want factory settings restored, then select “Finish.</b><b>”</b> Your computer will restart and display the Windows 7 setup screen.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Acer_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Acer">Acer</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.</b> Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Restart your computer and press the left Alt + F10 keys when the Acer logo displays on-screen.</b> This displays the Acer eRecovery Management application.
<ul>
<li>Press “Enter” if the Microsoft Windows boot screen appears to advance to the eRecovery Management window.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “Completely Restore System to Factory Defaults,” then click “Next.</b><b>”</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Click “Next” again to confirm you want to restore the original factory settings.</b> The restoration process will begin, which can take anywhere between 10 and 60 minutes. When factory restoration is complete, the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Toshiba_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Toshiba">Toshiba</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.</b> Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals.</b> This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Verify that your Toshiba computer is connected to a power source.</b> This prevents the computer from powering down during the factory restore process.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Restart your computer, then press and hold down the “0” key on the keyboard.</b> This brings up the recovery warning screen.
<ul>
<li>If the recovery warning screen fails to display, restart your computer and try again.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Click on “Yes” to confirm that you want to proceed with system recovery.</b> This opens the Toshiba Recovery Wizard.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select “Recovery of Factory Software,” the follow the on-screen instructions to restore your computer’s original factory settings.</b> Your computer will reboot several times throughout the process, and display the Windows 7 welcome screen when complete.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="All_Other_Brands_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>5</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="All_Other_Brands">All Other Brands</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_5">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.</b> Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Restart your Windows 7 computer, then watch your computer screen to find the appropriate bootup command.</b> In most cases, bootup commands will display at either the top or bottom of your screen.</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Press the appropriate bootup command to access your computer’s recovery partition.</b> Bootup commands will vary depending on your computer’s manufacturer:
<ul>
<li>Asus: Press F9</li>
<li>Lenovo: Press F11</li>
<li>MSI: Press F3</li>
<li>Samsung: Press F4</li>
<li>Sony: Press F10</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select the option to restore your computer to factory settings.</b> This option is labeled differently for each manufacturer, since each manufacturer uses different software for the built-in recovery partition. In most cases, this option will read as “Restore factory settings” or “Perform factory restore.”</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="final_li">
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Follow the on-screen instructions to restore the original factory settings.</b> Your computer may reboot several times throughout the process, which may take up to one hour to complete. When restoration is finished, the Windows setup wizard or welcome screen will display.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="7018548" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">

</li>

			{{/qa_desktop}}

					{{^verifierData.imagePath}}<span>{{verifierData.initials}}</span>{{/verifierData.imagePath}}</a>
			{{/verifierId}}

			{{^verifierId}}
				<div class="qa_person_circle" {{#submitterAvatar}}style="background-image:url({{{submitterAvatar}}})"{{/submitterAvatar}}></div>

	</div>
</li>

<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>If your computer’s recovery partition was wiped or erased on behalf of an error or virus, contact your computer’s manufacturer to obtain a Windows 7 recovery disk. The recovery disk will allow you to restore and reinstall Windows 7 on your system.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>Restoring your Windows 7 computer to the original factory settings will erase all files and programs excluding the default programs it came with. Back up all important files and data prior to restoring the factory settings.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

title: How to Restore a Computer to Factory Settings in Windows 7
content_html:
Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.
Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, and USB drives.
  • Remove your laptop from its docking station, if applicable.
Power on your computer and press F8 repeatedly when the Dell logo displays on-screen. This opens the Advanced Boot Options menu.
  • If the Advanced Boot Options menu fails to open, restart your computer and try again.
Select “Repair Your Computer” using the arrow keys, then press “Enter.” This opens the System Recovery Options menu
Select a keyboard layout and click “Next.”
Sign in as a local user or the administrator, then click “OK.”
Select either “Dell Factory Tools” or “Dell Factory Image Restore,” then click “Next.” This opens the Confirm Data Deletion menu.
Place a checkmark next to “Yes, reformat hard drive and restore system software to factory condition,” then click “Next.” Windows 7 will begin restoring factory settings, which will take at least five minutes to complete. When finished, Windows will inform you the computer has been restored to a factory-new condition.
Click on “Finish.” Your computer will restart and the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen.
Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.
Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives.
Power on your computer and click on the “Start” menu.
  • If Windows fails to boot up correctly and you cannot access the Start menu, press F11 repeatedly as your computer reboots to bring up the Recovery Manager window, then skip to step #7.
Click on “All Programs,” then select “Recovery Manager.”
Click on “Recovery Manager” again, then type the administrator password.
Select “Yes” when the User Account Control window asks if you want the program to make changes to your computer. The Recovery Manager window will display on-screen.
Select “System Recovery” below the section entitled “I need help immediately.”
Select “Yes,” then click “Next” when asked if you want the computer restored to its original factory condition. Your computer will reboot, and display the Recovery Manager window once again.
Select “System Recovery,” then select “Recover without backing up your files.”
Click on “OK” to confirm you want factory settings restored, then select “Finish.” Your computer will restart and display the Windows 7 setup screen.[1]
Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.
Restart your computer and press the left Alt + F10 keys when the Acer logo displays on-screen. This displays the Acer eRecovery Management application.
  • Press “Enter” if the Microsoft Windows boot screen appears to advance to the eRecovery Management window.
Select “Completely Restore System to Factory Defaults,” then click “Next.”[2]
Click “Next” again to confirm you want to restore the original factory settings. The restoration process will begin, which can take anywhere between 10 and 60 minutes. When factory restoration is complete, the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen.[3]
Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.
Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives.
Verify that your Toshiba computer is connected to a power source. This prevents the computer from powering down during the factory restore process.
Restart your computer, then press and hold down the “0” key on the keyboard. This brings up the recovery warning screen.
  • If the recovery warning screen fails to display, restart your computer and try again.
Click on “Yes” to confirm that you want to proceed with system recovery. This opens the Toshiba Recovery Wizard.
Select “Recovery of Factory Software,” the follow the on-screen instructions to restore your computer’s original factory settings. Your computer will reboot several times throughout the process, and display the Windows 7 welcome screen when complete.[4]
Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.
Restart your Windows 7 computer, then watch your computer screen to find the appropriate bootup command. In most cases, bootup commands will display at either the top or bottom of your screen.
Press the appropriate bootup command to access your computer’s recovery partition. Bootup commands will vary depending on your computer’s manufacturer:
  • Asus: Press F9
  • Lenovo: Press F11
  • MSI: Press F3
  • Samsung: Press F4
  • Sony: Press F10
Select the option to restore your computer to factory settings. This option is labeled differently for each manufacturer, since each manufacturer uses different software for the built-in recovery partition. In most cases, this option will read as “Restore factory settings” or “Perform factory restore.”
Follow the on-screen instructions to restore the original factory settings. Your computer may reboot several times throughout the process, which may take up to one hour to complete. When restoration is finished, the Windows setup wizard or welcome screen will display.[5]
